summary:
Aug 2021 - Jul 2024: Member, BICC International Board, www.bicc.de
2012- present: SSR and Post-conflict development consultant, based in Rotterdam, The Netherlands
2009-2012 Post Conflict Adviser in Aceh for the Delegation of the European Union to Indonesia
2008-2009 European Union Monitoring Mission in Georgia
2002-2006 Project manager of European Union Small Arms control project in Cambodia, see www.eu-asac.org, specialising in weapons collection, weapons stockpiling, weapons destruction etc.
Previous political, management and electoral experiece in UN and OSCE field missions in Eritrea/Ethiopia, Kosovo and Albania. Electoral missions in Kosovo, South Africa, Russia, Pakistan, Cambodia and Angola.
Further post-conflict development assistance in Rwanda, Tanzania, Liberia, Somaliland,

Specialties: i) Post-conflict management,
ii) Small Arms and Light Weapons control and management;
Futher expertise: 
 - Project management and financial control
 - Security Sector Reform (especially Community Policing)
 - DDR
 - Elections organisation and monitoring
 - Democratisation, support to civil society
 - Emergency Aid
Knowledge of South East Asia and Southern Africa

Project management also required additional fundraising from international donors, Netherlands, Germany, United Kingdom, Japan etc. of amounts to supplement European Union core funding.
Project closed in 2006 having achieved the goals set by the European Union Council of Ministers in 1999.', 'title': 'Special Adviser to European Commission/Project Manager', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'United Nations Mission in Ethiopia and Eritrea', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}}, 'company': 'United Nations Mission in Ethiopia and Eritrea', 'description': 'Analysing local and regional political, economic and social developments, monitoring the media and giving advice as to how these developments affect the peace process;  exchanging strategic analyses with diplomatic missions and other organisations, such as the OAU, involved in the peace process;  keeping contact with civil society organisations; preparing training materials and giving political briefings and induction courses;  assisting preparation of the reports of the U.N. Secretary-General to the Security Council;  For two months as Political Officer in Assab, Eastern Region.', 'title': 'Political Affairs Officer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'OSCE', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 1999}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2000}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 1999}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2000}}, 'company': 'OSCE', 'description': 'Responsible for the development of OSCE in the Region from 8 people in July 1999 to 100 people (25 international and 75 local staff) in December 1999 in four offices in a post-conflict situation with the city of Pejë/Pec having been severely damaged.  The OSCE was responsible for human rights monitoring, democratisation, media development and elections. Co-ordination of the OSCE programs and co-ordination with UNMIK Regional Administrator and local politicians to ensure stability in the Pejë/Pec region was a main task. Responsible for a watching brief on the democratisation and media development programs through dissemination of information.  Integration of local staff in the execution of the programs had a high priority.
In 2000 the Division of Political Party Services with six international and fourteen local staff was the contact point between the Kosovan political parties and the Central Election Commission (CEC).  Responsible for contacts with 28 Kosovan parties (including 6 minority parties) taking part in the first post-conflict municipal elections, checking their applications, establishing a database for 5,000 candidates in 30 municipalities, checking the qualifications of the candidates and making recommendations to the CEC.  Responsible for overseeing financial disclosures of political parties, organising the ballot lottery and editing short Voters’ Guide to political party platforms.  Advisor to the Political Party Consultative Forum.  Member of the six-person Electoral Planning Group coordinating the integration of electoral requirements of each division in the Department (including Communication and Complaints sections). Gave briefings to press and diplomatic and political visitors to Kosovo.  Regular speaker at meetings of Albanian Kosovan political party forums and Turkish community leaders explaining and encouraging involvement in the entire electoral process, this included dissemination of information.', 'title': 'Regional Director Peja/Head Political Party Services', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 5520, 'name': 'OSCE KVM Task Force Albania', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGxAE4bSSGs2w/company-logo_400_400/0/1521667701196?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=ThnDvajL6oA0DN_3lM6V8crMTvAVXWI0zRwuh2dHhHE', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/osce/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 1999}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 1999}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Tirana, Albania', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 1999}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 1999}}, 'company': 'OSCE', 'description': 'During war in Kosovo I was responsible for 8 Operations Room staff (international) and co-ordinating work of 30 field staff (international); obtaining information on refugee needs from 12 Field Teams throughout Albania; sending urgent requests to National Crisis Committee; writing daily SitReps to HQ in Macedonia; liaising with Albanian refugees, dealing with media issues with Head of Mission', 'title': 'Chief Operations', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Disaster Relief & Rehabilitation Agency (DRA)', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1994}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1998}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'The Hague, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1994}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1998}}, 'company': 'Disaster Relief & Rehabilitation Agency (DRA)', 'description': 'First responsible for co-ordinating and implementing Emergency Relief projects and then for developing new projects in new areas in Africa and the Balkans.', 'title': 'Emergency Co-ordination Officer/Project Development Officer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 354899, 'name': 'Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQGij2xmEG4knQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1691477973144?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=uhI6ETbpJ0ulZxE7G39BBNR9JKSTWIUxNSNqybZT8DI', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/ministeriebz/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1993}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1993}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rom Choing village, Oddar Meanchey province', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1993}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 1993}}, 'company': 'Ministerie van Buitenlandse Zaken', 'description': None, 'title': 'International Polling Station Organiser, Cambodia', 'employment_type': None}]}]
